item.title: 葛兰素史克将从 mRNA 诉讼和解中获得 5 亿美元赔偿
item.description: CureVac NV 公司与美国辉瑞公司（Pfizer Inc.【原文：CureVac NV has settled a long-running patent dispute over mRNA vaccines with Pfizer Inc. and BioNTech SE in the US, which will see CureVac’s former collaborator GSK Plc receive as much as $500 million and 1% of royalties from future vaccine sales.】

item.title: 中国需求帮助津巴布韦将烟草销量提升至创纪录水平
item.description: 在本周四结束的烟草销售季中，津巴布韦的烟草销售额猛增 48%，达到创纪录的 11 亿美元，这主要得益于中国需求的增长。【原文：Zimbabwe’s tobacco sales jumped 48% to a record $1.1 billion in the season that ended Thursday, helped by rising demand from China.】

item.title: 匈牙利通胀率超预期，支持谨慎加息
item.description: 由于食品和能源成本上升，匈牙利的通货膨胀率降幅低于预期，这支持了央行货币政策谨慎的论点。【原文：Hungary’s inflation rate dropped less than expected due to rising food and energy costs, bolstering arguments for the central bank’s monetary-policy caution.】

item.title: 中国股市市值因资金流入接近分水岭水平
item.description: 由于资金流入强劲，沪深证券交易所的总市值正朝着 100 万亿元（13.9 万亿美元）的里程碑水平攀升。【原文：The combined market capitalization of the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges is climbing toward a milestone level of 100 trillion yuan ($13.9 trillion) on strong fund inflows.】

item.title: 新交所濒临上市复兴，30 家 IPO 在列
item.description: 新加坡交易所（Singapore Exchange Ltd.）的一位高层管理人员表示，该交易所有大约 30 家公司正在寻求上市，这表明新加坡这个奄奄一息的新股票上市市场即将迎来转机。【原文：Singapore Exchange Ltd. has a pipeline of about 30 companies looking to go public, according to one of the bourse’s top executives, signaling that the city-state’s moribund market for new equity listings is about to turn a leaf.】

item.title: 泰航盈利大增，股价飙升至七年新高
item.description: 泰国国际航空公司（Thai Airways International Pcl）的股价攀升至近八年来的最高水平，因为这家国有控股航空公司报告称，第二季度的净收入比去年同期飙升了近 39 倍。【原文：Thai Airways International Pcl’s shares climbed to the highest level in almost eight years after the state-controlled airline reported that net income for the second quarter soared nearly 39-fold from a year earlier.】

item.title: 日本首相石破茂面临党内压力，领导地位岌岌可危
item.description: 日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）在上个月的上议院选举中成绩惨淡，削弱了他的执政地位，并引发了一些取代他担任领导人的内部势头。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is set to take further criticism from his own party in a plenary meeting that began Friday, following a dismal result in an upper house election last month that has weakened his mandate and triggered some internal momentum to replace him as leader.】

item.title: 特朗普要求辞职，英特尔首席执行官称获董事会支持
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp.英特尔公司首席执行官陈立武说，他得到了公司董事会的全力支持，首次回应了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普因利益冲突要求他辞职的呼吁。【原文：Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan said he’s got the full backing of the company’s board, responding for the first time to US President Donald Trump’s call for his resignation over conflicts of interest.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势再现，新兴市场资产涨势受阻
item.description: 由于与美国的贸易紧张局势再次出现，且下周将有关键数据公布，新兴市场资产周五在亚洲的反弹停滞不前。【原文：A rally in emerging-market assets stalled in Asia Friday as trade tensions with the US resurface and with key data due next week.】

item.title: 东洋轮胎上调展望，提高美国产量以抵御关税冲击
item.description: 东洋轮胎公司计划通过价格调整、调整生产结构和改变生产战略，包括投资 300 亿日元扩大在美国的产量，来消化 126 亿日元（8560 万美元）的关税影响。【原文：Toyo Tire Corp. plans to absorb a ¥12.6 billion ($85.6 million) tariff impact through price adjustments, a production mix overhaul and a change in manufacturing strategy, including a ¥30 billion investment to expand its US output.】

item.title: 铜价每周上涨，Codelco 崩溃成焦点
item.description: 由于交易商评估了智利最大矿山 Codelco 在一次致命事故后关闭所带来的影响，铜价每周都将上涨。【原文：Copper is set for a weekly increase as traders assess the impacts of the closure of Codelco’s biggest mine in Chile following a fatal accident.】

item.title: 印度基金以四月以来最大规模的买盘支撑市场
item.description: 周四，印度国内机构进行了四个月来最大规模的本地股票购买，为受唐纳德-特朗普总统关税升级影响的市场提供了缓冲。【原文：India’s domestic institutions made their largest purchase of local stocks in four months on Thursday, providing a cushion to markets reeling from President Donald Trump’s escalation of tariffs.】

item.title: 美国通过海底电缆规则应对中国安全风险
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周四批准了加快海底数据电缆部署和安全的新规则，理由是来自中国和其他外国对手的威胁日益严重。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission on Thursday approved new rules to accelerate the deployment and security of subsea data cables, citing growing threats from China and other foreign adversaries.】

item.title: 俄罗斯乌拉尔油田向中国炼油商兜售石油，中国炼油商跃跃欲试
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统就印度从莫斯科购买原油一事对印度发难之际，俄罗斯的旗舰产品乌拉尔原油正在向中国买家迅速供应，这是全球石油市场发生变化的一个迹象。【原文：Prompt supplies of Russia’s flagship Urals crude are being offered to Chinese buyers, a sign of shifts in the global oil market as President Donald Trump takes aim at India over its purchases from Moscow.】

item.title: 欧洲最热门的新信贷交易都与国防有关
item.description: 6 月底，北约领导人在海牙聚首，商讨大幅增加军费开支的计划时，伦敦的银行家们正忙着统计投资者对捷克一家鲜为人知的装甲车和弹药制造商所发行债券的订单。【原文：As NATO leaders huddled in The Hague in late June to iron out a plan to radically boost military spending, bankers in London were busy adding up the investor orders for a bond being offered by a little-known Czech maker of armored vehicles and ammunition.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯希望分拆海军部队以利用欧洲防务热潮
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯公司（Thyssenkrupp AG）正着手裁撤其军舰部门，希望借助欧洲国防开支激增的东风，同时退出这一长期以来发展缓慢、成本高昂且难以扩大规模的业务。【原文：Thyssenkrupp AG is moving to cut loose its warship unit, hoping to ride a surge in European defense spending while stepping back from a business that has long been slow, costly, and hard to scale.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚因通胀飙升风险将维持利率不变：决策指南
item.description: 在为帮助抑制预算赤字而掀起的增税浪潮预计将导致通胀飙升之前，罗马尼亚准备维持借贷成本不变。【原文：Romania is poised to keep borrowing costs unchanged ahead of an expected surge in inflation from a wave of tax hikes designed to help curb the budget deficit.】

item.title: 特朗普意外获选美联储主席为其赢得时间
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统临时填补美联储一个职位的举动为他提供了一个在央行安插盟友的机会，同时也给了他更多的时间来权衡一个更大的决定：谁将成为下一任美联储主席。【原文：President Donald Trump’s move to fill a slot at the Federal Reserve on a temporary basis offers him a chance to install an ally at the central bank, while giving him more time to weigh an even larger decision: who will be the next Fed Chair.】

item.title: 英国与津巴布韦重启关系，力争获得关键矿产
item.description: 津巴布韦和英国在近三十年的紧张关系后重启外交关系，原因是全球对重要矿产的需求激增，促使前殖民国家与这个资源丰富的国家达成了 10 亿美元的交易。【原文：Zimbabwe and the UK are rekindling diplomatic ties after almost three decades of tension, driven by a global surge in demand for critical minerals that’s led the former colonial power to pursue $1 billion in deals with the resource-rich nation.】

item.title: 瑞典 7 月公寓价格创 2022 年以来最大降幅
item.description: 瑞典的公寓价格出现了近三年来最大的月度跌幅，这进一步表明这个北欧最大国家的家庭正变得更加谨慎。【原文：Sweden’s apartment prices experienced their largest monthly fall in almost three years, adding to signs that households in the largest Nordic nation are turning more cautious.】

item.title: 印尼基准收益率降至近两年来最低点
item.description: 由于降息预期升温、海外资金流入和美元走软，印尼10年期国债收益率跌至2023年9月以来的最低水平。【原文：Indonesia’s 10-year government bond yield fell to the lowest level since September 2023 due to rising interest-rate cuts expectations, overseas inflows and a soft US dollar.】

item.title: 印尼将两名议员列为工商局贪污案首批嫌疑人
item.description: 印尼反贪局已确定两名议员为涉嫌腐败案的首批嫌疑人，该案涉及印尼央行和印尼金融服务监管机构。【原文：The Indonesian anti-graft agency has identified two lawmakers as the first suspects in an alleged corruption case involving the central bank and the country’s financial services regulator.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官被数十年的中国芯片投资和董事会工作所困扰

item.description: 以色列安全内阁已批准本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理全面控制加沙城的计划，以最后一搏推翻哈马斯，结束长达 22 个月的战斗。【原文：Israel’s security cabinet has approved Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plans to take full control of Gaza City in a final push to topple Hamas and end 22 months of fighting.】

item.title: 美元走软缓解亚洲货币捍卫者的压力
item.description: 对亚洲各国央行来说，最坏的情况可能已经过去，因为在美元回升和美国新关税加剧整个地区的压力之后，亚洲各国央行已经加大了捍卫本币的力度。【原文：The worst may be over for Asia’s central banks that have ramped up efforts defending local currencies after a resurgent dollar and fresh US tariffs fueled pressure across the region.】
